topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555470fe6368725b7efd0800#post_555470fe6368725b7efd0800
Nah; probably going to be only a decade though, but that's going to be for say servers or large companies.  It'll probably be 15 years until it finds it's way into personal computers.

Neurochips on the other hand we can totally make them and that; it's just that since they're a new concept it's going to take years until the cost is driving down enough for them to find their way into personal computers.

The reason why *some* people are saying we might have sapient ai by as early as 2030 is because if you have large scale production of neurochips on top of quantum processors then holy fuck.

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555473276368723a0f192c00#post_555473276368723a0f192c00
What's funny is that the usa and other countries are starting to pull ahead on the cybernetics front.

Why?  In the EU neuroscientists are getting death threats for experimenting on apes and having to double down by experimenting on rats.  In the long run basically the EU is fucking themselves, because in say 10-15 years that means they'll be so far behind they legitimately won't be able to catch up.

You know how overwhelmingly the majority of computer parts aren't made in europe and instead say stuff like, "this part was made in taiwan", "this part was made in the usa", etc?  Yeah; that's going to happen with implants as well.

Essentially the problem with cybernetic development in europe, "Let's send death threats to neuroscientists! . . Oh shit!  Why are we falling behind technology wise?!"
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555474856368723a0f822e00#post_555474856368723a0f822e00
"Experimental eye implant prototypes are already in production":http://news.rutgers.edu/feature/news-bionic-eye-implant-mayo-clinic-surgeon-rutgers-alumnus-goes-viral/20150419

topics.body:
So Windows (operating system) might be becoming irrelevant.

To make it short:
Basically when it comes to phones Microsoft has clearly gotten their ass kicked cause Android and iOS just curb stomp them.
Tablets both iOS and Android curb stomps Microsoft.
On servers they're not doing bad, but they're not doing great either and they probably will do better cause they're going to introduce a not-shitty windows server version next time.

For desktop computers the problem they're having is that cause they have two good products out nobody is upgrading.  A lot of people still use Windows XP and Microsoft has been trying everything under the sun to get them to upgrade but they won't.  The problem with windows 8 is that cause windows 7 wasn't pretty okay that caused windows 8 to be dead on arrival; no matter how many discounts they offered it was dead on arrival.  Unless Microsoft hits the ball out of the park and delivers a homerun on Windows 10 it's going to be dead on arrival.

Short version: Microsoft legit has to come out with a version of Windows that is better than Windows 7 or Windows XP cause they can't fuck up *yet again*.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
